newsitem.title: BRAZIL: Brazil bolsa suspends CVRD auction.
newsitem.headline: Brazil bolsa suspends CVRD auction.

text.p: The stock exchange in Rio de Janeiro suspended the auction of Brazilian state mining giant Companhia Vale do Rio Doce (CVRD) because of a court order, an official said.

Bolsa superintendent Sergio Berargi said bidding for the company, which had already begun, would remain suspended until government lawyers had examined the court injunction, which was issued by a regional tribunal in Rio de Janeiro.
"The auction is suspended due to a court injunction," he said.

The injunction was carried dramatically onto the stock exchange floor under the full glare of a dozen television cameras when the bidding had already reached 30.20 reais per share compared with a minimum price of 26.67 reais per share.
The leader in the bidding was broker Bozano, Simonsen representing the consortium led by Brazilian conglomerate Votorantim and South Africa's Anglo-American Corp.

Tereza Cristina Aquino, privatization superintendent of the Naitonal Development Bank, said the bank was happy with the 13.22 percent premium so far on the base price because it had been expecting a premium of 10-15 percent.
